qas.question: What did The Irish Sun stop doing in 2013?
What was stated to be the last edition of the regular Sun to publish topless models?
Which newspaper claimed that The Sun stopped featuring topless models in 2013?

answers.text: Page 3 returned to its usual format

qas.question: What did The Sun's Head of PR say about the reported editorial change at The Sun?

answers.text: the reputed end of Page 3 had been "speculation" only

context: In August 2013, The Irish Sun ended the practice of <a0_0>featuring topless models on Page 3<a0_0/>. The main newspaper was reported to have followed in 2015 with <a1_0>the edition of 16 January<a1_0/> supposedly the last to carry such photographs after a report in <a2_0>The Times<a2_0/> made such an assertion. After substantial coverage in the media about an alleged change in editorial policy, <a3_0>Page 3 returned to its usual format<a3_0/> on 22 January 2015. A few hours before the issue was published, the Head of PR at the newspaper said <a4_0>the reputed end of Page 3 had been "speculation" only<a4_0/>.
